qas.question: How long was Nanjing the capital of the Southern dynasties?

answers.text: more than two and a half centuries

qas.question: During the time of the North–South division, what city was the center of East Asia?
During the time of the North–South division, how many households were in Nanjing?
What is the estimated population of Nanjing during that time?
Where did the information on registered households during that period originate?

context: During the period of North–South division, <a1_0>Nanjing<a1_0/> remained the capital of the Southern dynasties for <a0_0>more than two and a half centuries<a0_0/>. During this time, Nanjing was the international hub of East Asia. Based on <a4_0>historical documents<a4_0/>, the city had <a2_0>280,000 registered households<a2_0/>. Assuming an average Nanjing household had about 5.1 people at that time, the city had <a3_0>more than 1.4 million residents<a3_0/>.
